attributes.action: Regulate the amount of money one is able to borrow to buy a house.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
House price inflation can only be controlled by limiting the money supply.
By ensuring that one can only borrow 2.5 times their income for example, as it used to be many years ago, to fund the purchase of a house, the market would return to some degree of stability overnight and people would not end up with unsustainable levels of debt for the rest of their lives.

To borrow even more money to ensure that your own house is still only worth the same, relatively speaking, as the house next door, is simply ridiculous.
To think that you are actually better off by doing so beggars belief, unless of course you receive the benefits of IHT, Stamp Duty, VAT and the like, in which case, carry on regardless.
